intro: Cryptocarya floydii, commonly known as Floyd's cryptocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal shrublands and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in coastal dunes and cliffs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
